SEARCH
Package com.example.booking.service

Class DeviceMonitoringService

java.lang.Object
com.example.booking.service.DeviceMonitoringService
@Service public class DeviceMonitoringService extends Object
Service for monitoring device metrics such as battery level and memory usage.

This service initializes monitoring tasks for mobile devices upon application startup, handling device contexts and invoking monitoring tasks to periodically check and update device metrics.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • DeviceMonitoringService

      public DeviceMonitoringService()

  • Method Details

    • initializeAndStartMonitoring

      @EventListener(org.springframework.boot.context.event.ApplicationReadyEvent.class) public void initializeAndStartMonitoring()
      Initializes device contexts and starts monitoring upon application readiness.

      This method is triggered by the ApplicationReadyEvent, ensuring that the monitoring starts only after the application has been fully initialized.

      Fetches all mobile phones from the repository, converts them to device contexts, and starts monitoring each device with configured tasks.

    • getAllPhoneStatuses

      public String getAllPhoneStatuses()
      Retrieves the status of all monitored devices.
      Returns:
      A collection or string representing the status of all devices.

    • onMobilePhoneAdded

      @EventListener public void onMobilePhoneAdded(MobilePhoneAddedEvent event)
      Handles the MobilePhoneAddedEvent to set up monitoring for the new mobile phone.

      This method responds to the MobilePhoneAddedEvent by creating a new DeviceMonitor for the added phone and starts monitoring its metrics.

      Parameters:
      event - The event that gets fired when a new mobile phone is added.

    • monitorAndUpdateDeviceMetrics

      @Scheduled(fixedDelay=10000L) public void monitorAndUpdateDeviceMetrics()
      Periodically checks and updates the metrics of booked devices.

      This scheduled task runs every 10 seconds to update device metrics for devices that are not currently available (assumed to be booked). It checks if the free memory is below a certain threshold and updates metrics accordingly.

    • updateDeviceMonitorContext

      public void updateDeviceMonitorContext(DeviceMonitor oldMonitor, DeviceContext newContext)
      Updates the context of a device monitor for a given device.

      If the DeviceMonitor for a device needs to be updated with new context information, this method replaces the old DeviceMonitor with a new one initialized with the new context.

      Parameters:
      oldMonitor - The existing DeviceMonitor that needs to be updated.
      newContext - The new DeviceContext information for the DeviceMonitor.
